translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Thomaka
Aggapupphiya’s Story
The One with Golden Skin, the Awakened One,
was sitting in the mountains;
Shining with radiance,
like the crest of a flame.

analyzed: agga jam puppham ādāya  upāgacchim naruttama
translated: Taking the best flower,🔽I approached the Best of Men;
With a clear mind, full of joy,
I offered it to the Buddha.
Thirty-one eons ago,
the flower I offered in worship;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For twenty-five eons,
there was the one who went beyond measure;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Aggapupphiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā aggapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Aggapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai aggapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  aggapupphiya therassa apadānam dasama
translated: Aggapupphiya’s Story, the tenth.
The twenty-sixth chapter is concluded.🔽The summary:
Thomaka, seat, funeral pyre,
champaka, seven trumpet flowers;
Betel leaf, flower cluster, leaf,
hut, Aggapupphiya;
If the verses are counted here,
They are just one more than a hundred.
